required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multi-center,Randomized,Double-blind,Placebo-controlled,Phase 3 Study Evaluating Favipiravir in Treatment of COVID19
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Phase III Clinical Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Favipiravir in the Treatment of Adult Patients With COVID-19-Moderate Type

collaborator.agency: Opera CRO, a TIGERMED Group Company

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, phase III clinical study to evaluate the efficacy of Favipiravir combined with supportive care for adult patients with COVID-19-Moderate type.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a multi-center, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled (1:1) clinical study to explore the efficacy and safety of Favipiravir

primary_outcome.measure: Time from randomization to clinical recovery

secondary_outcome.measure: Negativity in RT-PCR nucleic acid test
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to negativity in RT-PCR nucleic acid test for 2019-nCov within 28 days of randomization;

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from randomization to resolution of pyrexia
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to resolution of pyrexia (defined the same as for the primary efficacy variable; applicable to subjects with pyrexia at enrolment) within 28 days of randomization;

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from randomization to relief of cough

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of deterioration/aggravation of pneumonia (defined as SPO2≤93% or PaO2/FiO2 ≤300 mmHg or distressed RR≥30/min without oxygen inhalation and requiring oxygen therapy or more advanced breath support) within 28 days of randomization;

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from randomization to relief of dyspnoea
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to relief of dyspnoea (defined as subject-perceived improvement or resolution of dyspnoea; applicable to subjects with dyspnoea at enrolment) within 28 days of randomization;

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of auxiliary oxygen therapy or non-invasive ventilation
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of auxiliary oxygen therapy or non-invasive ventilation within 28 days of randomization;

secondary_outcome.measure: ICU admission rate within 28 days of randomization
secondary_outcome.description: ICU admission rate within 28 days of randomization (except patients already enrolled in ICU which respect eligibility criteria);

secondary_outcome.measure: All-cause mortality within 28 days of randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality within 28 days of randomization.

arm_group.description: Favipiravir Tablets, 200 mg/tablet Favipiravir combined with supportive care recommended in the current National/Local guidelines. Favipiravir dosage and method of administration: Day 1: 1800mg, BID; Day 2 and thereafter: 600mg, TID, for a maximum of 14 days.
Placebo control group Favipiravir combined with supportive care recommended in the current National/Local guidelines

intervention.description: Favipiravir combined with supportive care recommended in the current National/Local guidelines. Favipiravir dosage and method of administration: Day 1 1800 mg x2; Day 2 up to a maximum of 14 days 600 mg x 3
Placebo combined with supportive care recommended in the current National/Local guidelines. Placebo dosage and method of administration: Day 1 1800 mg x2; Day 2 up to a maximum of 14 days 600 mg x 3

overall_contact.last_name: Dionisio Barattini, MD Europe, Opera CRO

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine
